Animals¶

The Animals module¶

This is a file that creates animals by using the class function

class biosim.Animals.Animal(properties)[source]¶

This is a class for animals on the island. Parent class for Herbivore and Carnivore

Initializing animal class for given values

Parameters

properties (dict) – dictionary containing species, age and weight for an animal

aging()[source]¶

A function for aging the animal

birth_probability(n)[source]¶

Animals can mate if there are two or more animals of the same species in the same cell. The animals can give birth with a probability, which depends on fitness and weight. If the newborn weighs more than the mother, the probability of birth is zero.

Parameters

n (float) – number of animals in the cell

Returns

the probability of birth

Return type

float

birth_weight_function()[source]¶

Sets value of birth weight from a gaussian distribution

birth_weight_loss(newborn_birth_weight)[source]¶

If the mother gives birth, she looses weight

Params newborn_birth_weight

the weight of the newborn

death_probability()[source]¶

The animal dies if it weighs nothing, but also with a probability

Returns

the probability of dying

Return type

float

fitness()[source]¶

The animal has a certain fitness. This function calculates the fitness for one animal, but does not update continuously

move_single_animal()[source]¶

If the random number generated is less than prob_move, the animal will try to move

Returns

True if the animal will try to move, False if not

Return type

bool

classmethod set_given_parameters(params)[source]¶

Saves new parameters for the different animals for use in Animals class

Raises

ValueError – if invalid landscape type is given in geography string

weight_gain(consumption)[source]¶

The animal gains weight everytime they eat. In this function, appetite is described as what is eaten, but in some cases that is not possible.

Parameters

consumption (float) – amount of fodder the animal consumes

weight_loss()[source]¶

The animal loses weight each year

will_the_animal_die()[source]¶

If the random number generated is less than the probability the animal will die

Returns

True if animal dies, False if it survives

Return type

bool

will_the_animal_give_birth(n)[source]¶

If the random number generated is less than the probability for birth, the birth will not take place

Parameters

n (float) – number of animals in the cell

Returns

True if the birth takes place, False if not

Return type

bool

class biosim.Animals.Carnivore(properties)[source]¶

this is a class for carnivores on the island

initialisation of weight and age for a new herbivore

Parameters

properties (dict) – dictionary containing species, weight and age

probability_kill_herbivore(herb)[source]¶

The carnivore kills a herbivore with probability prob_kill

Parameters

herb (class Herbivore) – the herbivore the carnivore will try to kill

Returns

probability of killing

Return type

float

weight_gain_after_eating_herb(herb)[source]¶

After eating the carnivore gains weight relative to the eaten herbivore

Parameters

herb (class herbivore) – the herbivore the carnivore eats

will_carn_kill(herb)[source]¶

If the generated number is less than the probability for killing, the carnivore will eat the herbivore

Parameters

herb (class Herbivore) – the herbivore the carnivore will try to kill

Returns

True if it will eat, False if not

Return type

bool

class biosim.Animals.Herbivore(properties)[source]¶

this is a class for herbivores on the island

Initialisation of weight and age for a new herbivore

Parameters

properties (dict) – dictionary containing species, weight and age

eat_fodder(F_cell)[source]¶

Herbivores tries to eat a certain amount in a year. However, how much the animal actually consumes depends on how much fodder is available in the cell.

F_cell: how much food in the cell F: how much the herbivore wants to eat in a year (appetite) F_consumption: how much the herbivore actually eats

After the consumption the herbivore gains weight

Parameters

F_cell (float) – the amount of fodder available in the cell

Raises ValueError

if there is a nonnegative amount of fodder

biosim
